intro: Veronica archboldii subsp. ellipticophylla, commonly known as the ellipticophylla speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are typically elliptic in shape, which gives it its subspecies name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
